alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 8:52PM EST until January 12 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following river in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... White River .Upwards of two inches of rainfall last weekend put several rivers across central and southern Indiana into flood. Minor flooding is now confined to the White River from about Petersburg southward in southwest Indiana. The river level is expected to linger near flood stage through Tuesday night in the Petersburg area, and fall from about 3 feet above flood stage in the Hazleton area through Wednesday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Govenors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Saturday /6:30 PM CST Saturday/ the stage was 16.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EST Saturday /6:30 PM CST Saturday/ was 18.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 15.9 feet and then begin rising tomorrow evening. It will then rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to 16.6 feet Monday morning. It will fall to 16.4 feet and then begin rising early Monday afternoon. It will then rise again to 16.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall below flood stage again Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 845 PM CST /945 PM EST/.
